sentences: Meie oskamist on veel palju arendada.
context: 'Oskad' is the second person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'oskama', which means 'to know how to' or 'to be able to'. It's used when asking someone if they have a skill or ability, similar to asking 'Can you...?' in English. The word indicates possession of knowledge or capability to perform an action.
